are you not entertained ?

[ cheering, chanting ]
spaniard !  Spaniard !
Spaniard !  Spaniard !

comments.author: Marvelous Chester

comments.text: If they're in Rome, why are they speaking with British accents?﻿
comments.author: Brandon

comments.text:
It's a movie convention - when meant to be speaking a language that isn't 
English, the accents tend to be British.  Ironically, typical of most 
languages that develop outside of the motherland, rhotic American English 
is actually an older language than non-rhotic UK & East Coast English.  The 
upper classes started dropping their rs, which eventually made its way to 
everybody else.  It's like Dwight from The Office says of the version of 
German that he learned and speaks in Pennsylvania, it's pre-industrial.

comments.text: Why are none of them wearing full body armor? That makes no sense lol﻿
comments.author: Serotonergic

comments.text:
It was actually very rare for anyone but the most wealthy to have full set 
of armor.  this is true across most cultures and time-frames, at least up 
until we were able to mass produce things like Kevlar.    Even actual 
soldiers going to war were never that well armored.  Knights in Europe who 
wore all the full armor they are so famous for were mostly from noble or 
wealthy families. Usually full metal armor had to be made to fit the 
individual, way to much time, money, and effort to spend on a guy who's 
only job is to die dramatically.
comments.author: Stellra52

comments.text:
Along the lines of previous statements that they are slaves not soldiers. 
Armor would be extremely costly to make back then with the techniques they 
had at their disposal. A cost of far more than a slave. Plus, I wonder if 
the attention spans of the Roman people would start to wane in a slow, 
cumbersome fight between heavily armored opponents. It's like today. People 
want what they came for and they want it fast. Consider this to be the 
"action movie" of the day as opposed to a long, drawn out play for the more 
attentive.

comments.author: Amy

comments.text:
Because they are slave gladiators and not one of those professional Roman 
legionaries?

It's a sports to the Romans, not warfare. It's one area of real combat 
where equipment for the combatants were chosen, quite literally, for the 
rule of cool and not any kind of convenience or efficacy.
